alert.note: Alert for Iowa; Sauk (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 9:59PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Iowa and Sauk Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 958 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles east of New Rome to 9 miles west of Necedah to near Hillsboro to 14 miles south of Viroqua to near Garnavillo. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Baraboo, Reedsburg, Wisconsin Dells, Lake Delton, West Baraboo, Highland, Plain, North Freedom, Centerville, Avoca, Orion, Cobb, La Valle, Rock Springs, Clyde, Loganville, Rewey, Ironton, Lime Ridge and Blackhawk Lake Rec Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
